page.title: 08Language - Local dialect
page.content: The dialect spoken by the very old people of Holme and the surrounding area is what we call "broad Yorkshire". Some of the words which are now dying out in our area are "causey - a pavement (from the word causeway) "gradely" - applied to a peerson - fine, nice-looking, upstanding. "He's a gradely lad". "throng" - very busy. (A favourite local expression used to be "He's as throng as Throp's wide' "spetch" - a sticking plaster (Elastoplast) "spice" - sweets "spell" - a splinter (I've got a spell in m' finger). We also use words derived from the woollen industry e.g. 'frame' to do well, show promise (Frame thisen, lad!)
